Join us on a trip down the rabbit hole! Cheshire Alley - the most fun dive bar on the playa!! Stop by for some afternoon and evening silliness, cool drinks, games, and black light body / face painting. We host super fun themed parties Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings.

Down the Rabbit Hole!
Join us for silly interactive games, cool drinks (N/A too!), evening black light face and body painting.
We're bringing back the ever popular "Put a ring on it!" Dildo toss and strap-on catch game!

Join us on your journey down the rabbit hole and through the looking glass. No one knows where this will lead but it's a perfect start! We're a group of cool cats from the US, Canada, Mexico, Spain, and Thailand. Come say hello and go mad with us!

As the sun sets, Cheshire Alley comes alive with music, black light, and activities. It's the perfect place to start an amazing night! Our crazy cats and other international characters will create a daily cocktail, help you master black light face painting, spin the wheel of misfortune to determine your evening's fate.

All are welcome at Cheshire Alley with a cool place to relax, get creative, play games, make new friends, share a beverage, have a snack, sing a song and watch life pass by on the playa.

We're a group of cool cats from United States, Canada, Mexico and Spain. Come say hello and get mad with us!

We like to hang out together and get to know people like you while get up to silly shenanigans. Throughout the day, we host spontaneous Mad Tea Parties, serving alcoholic teatime beverages and teacake sized appetizers to nosh on. As well as Pink Flamingo Croquet, Rabbit Hole, Dirty Word of the Day, and our Wheel of Misfortune

We're also hosting a couple great Unbirthday parties Monday and Tuesday nights at 7PM. Come on over - even if it's your birthday! 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/CheshireAlley/

There's a lot going on at Cheshire Alley. Join us!

Come play Flamingo Croquet every afternoon into the evening. No headlamps required as the course lights up when the sun sets. 

And, when the sun sets we also have black light face painting. You can paint yourself, but, where's the fun in that? It's more entertaining to paint others or have new friends decorate you!

Our hosts at the "Last Restaurant in the Universe" and the "Round About Bar" are on hand serving amazing drinks and snacks.

Down the rabbit hole or through the looking glass, join this mad mad group of mythical characters to create fantastical paintings, glow in the dark body art and pink flamingo croquet.  Doesn't matter if you're larger or small, our reality has room for all.

Dye With Dignity provides silk scarves and all necessary elements to create your own tie dye work of art on playa! On none dye days we provide snow cones and frozen margaritas.

Burn and Dye! Spin the Wheel of Remorse, drink some cold Texas wine, dye a silk scarf. What could be better?

Dye a silk scarf! Drink wine! Have a snow cone or margarita in our huge monkey hut! OR visit the Mermaid Bar and enjoy a tropical rum concoction. Spin the Wheel of Remorse! We bring all the supplies needed so you can create your own piece of functional art (a silk scarf is an excellent dust mask). Lounge in our shade while drinking an icy beverage and play board games with new friends. The Wheel of Remorse has entertained our neighborhood for six years now and also features a kid friendly side. Our "line tenders" look for kids in line and immediately bring them to the front of the line, flip the wheel around, and give the kiddos a kid friendly task to complete from the wheel. We love kids and invite you to bring your kiddos to play with us.
Come dye with us! We provide silk/dye and all materials for you to create your own piece of playa art magic.

Dye with Dignity provides silk, dye, wine, margaritas, snow cones and lots of love to help you create your own piece of playa magic. Come dye a silk scarf (or sarong during our surprise event!), spin the Wheel of Shame, entertain the neighbors and feel the love!
Create your own work of art! We provide all you need to dye your own silk scarf while cooling off with chilled wine or juice.

Discover Playa Paul's Concierge Service, where unparalleled support meets the spirit of Burning Man. Our camp redefines the playa experience with a suite of services, including daily gourmet coffee service, refreshing afternoon beverages, and personalized RV maintenance. Embrace the convenience of our on-site concierge including pump outs, water, and art tour bookings. Each evening, join our vibrant community gatherings for networking and relaxation. Our interactive art installations and dedicated spaces foster creativity and connection. At Playa Paul's, we ensure your journey is as fulfilling and comfortable as the memories you'll create. 
At Playa Pauls you are a VIPP!

Fusion Valley is one of the oldest camps on the playa! Founded some time in the 90s, we are a collection of sweet and surly geeks and artists dedicated to keeping you safe through the ministrations of Black Rock Ultra Safe (BRUSe). Come on by for a rest in our shade, play board games, test your coordination on our obstacle course, troll the inter webs, watch a weird movie or two, and participate in the first running of the Burntucky Derby!

Fusion Valley is one of the oldest camps on the playa! Founded some time in the 90s, we are a collection of sweet and surly geeks and artists dedicated to keeping you safe through the ministrations of Black Rock Ultra Safe (BRUSe). Come on by for a rest in our shade, play board games, test your coordination on our obstacle course, troll the inter webs, and watch a weird movie or two.

Visit beautiful Fusion Valley! One of the oldest camps on the playa. Founded in 1999, Fusion Valley offers internet access in our shaded lounge, board games and story time for kids, music and radio shows, and an obstacle course during the day, In the evening, watch the animation and film offerings from our inaugural film and animation festival. You never know when a spontaneous party might break out!

Burning Man's Misinformation Technology camp & home of the RatchetFish artist too! You are invited to swing by and hang out & play games with us in our public, carpeted shade. Join us for a card or tabletop game, use our internet-connected wi-fi, or try using our phone, if you dare.  Speaking of dare: Fusion Valley is proud to be the home of Black Rock Ultra Safe, the finest danger prevention agency in the land! Black Rock Ultra Safe uses cutting edge danger prevention equipment and advanced safety theory such as Safe Relativity & Quantum Safety to "Prevent all danger immediately, 1 Cone at a time!" Tune into Fusion Valley Radio at 95.7 to hear whatever it is we're playing. At night, feast your eyes on our drive-in theater of cinematic abortions. Take a load off & say hi!

Fusion Valley is Burning Man's Misinformation Technology camp built and staffed by a bunch of surly geeks as well as bonafide Burningman Staff types. You are invited to swing by and hang out and play games with us in our public, carpeted shade. Join us for a card or tabletop game, play our arcade games, use our internet-connected wi-fi, or try using our phone, if you dare. Tune into Fusion Valley Radio at 95.7 to hear whatever it is we're playing (Feel free to join us for some radio shows as well!) and learn about whatever events people clue us in on, and at night, feast your eyes on our drive-in theater of cinematic abortions. Take a load off and say hi to some long time BM staff & burners.

Take a load off and say hi to some long time BM staff & burners.

The Co-Reality Collective (CRC) is an international group of burners, artists, philosophers, technologists and polymaths who hosted magical online parties for their communities during lockdown. These creative not-for-profit community events featured immersive theater, fun shops, play shops and forged friendships hosted through an interlinked web of zoom rooms.

CRC is returning to playa to bring forth their immersive theater, fun shops, play shops and friendship, in Real Life (IRL) to hold creative space at Black Rock City 2023.

From the dust and destruction of Elephant Bird Camp and Grandma's Camp comes Irrelephant Bird Camp. Grahama's last, dying wish was for Elephant Bird Camp to return to the playa and with it bring dorkier, sillier, funkier, messier, and even more friendly-er people and events, but with more Irr than ever before.

From the dust and destruction of Elephant Bird Camp, comes Irrelephant Bird Camp, Grahama’s last dying wish, which was for Elephant Bird Camp to return to the playa and with it bringing dorkier, sillier, funkier, messier, and even more friendly-er people and events, but with more Irr than ever before, which everyone likes because people can’t get enough Irr in their life, as we all know, so that is why we are the best but also the most modest there ever was and that is grand, which also explains how we are gods among men/women/small flightless birdies, the tiniest, sweetest, tastiest, look-but-don’t touch-fishies, for which there is no replacement, no better leader, no better warrior, no better crocheter of crotchless panties than you.

Lollypopoluis is a theme camp based in Portland Oregon with campers from Portland, Boise, Montreal, CA and Tokyo Japan. We are focused on Self Care and provide the Self Care Pharmacy for those items you may have forgotten or didn't know you'd need. Join us in the Circus tent for music, food, beverages and connection!

Lollypopolus is a Theme camp focused on self care, volunteer and medical support, disabilities support (deaf, blind, immobile), and general all around silly fun. Organization and commitment are the core of this camp.

Most of what we learn from the world around us is due to perception, cognition and activities are mediated through vision. Our mission creates opportunity for individuals to become inspired by fire, feel the flow, and take action to improve their physical and mental wellbeing. Inspiring both newcomers and world-class professionals alike to continue their personal flow journey, Vulcan Empire is a vessel for spreading the Fire and Flow arts.

Our mission creates opportunity for individuals to become inspired by fire, feel the flow, and take action to improve their physical and mental wellbeing. Inspiring both newcomers and world-class professionals alike to continue their personal flow journey, Vulcan Empire is a vessel for spreading the Fire and Flow arts.

Creating a network of motivated movement artists working to teach, spread, and promote fire, flow, or circus arts around the world. Working together to create Vulcan Empire in Black Rock City builds our network and allows us a space to reach each other from our many diverse paths in life. We hope our diaspora inspire and influence each other and continue to support each other long after the dust settles.

We are a flow arts and circus camp, people of all skill levels welcome! 
Come chill out under our shaded workshop space fully equipped with foam tile dance floor and plenty of props to play with. This space is available to use anytime throughout the day or night that workshops are not happening. 

Workshops available Monday - Friday 11am - 4pm and Wednesday - Friday 10pm - 1am 

Flow and Fire Jams Monday night at 8pm and Saturday night at 11pm

Spin and shake all the things at Vulcan Empire Monday - Friday under our shaded space, we have plenty of props for you to play with. No experience? No worries, we will teach you! Don't forget to stop by for out Monday night fire jam! Stop by camp to view our full schedule for the week!

Come spin, juggle, and shake all the things! We have a shaded space with plenty of practice props for you to play with, and we teach daytime workshops in poi, staff, hoop, rope dart, fans, yoga, twerking, and more!

We will be hosting spinners from all of the world that are coming to teach you anything you would like to know in their respective fields.

Discover the essence of Eastern Europe at BARBORIS, where we serve only the finest Russian, Ukrainian, and Eastern European vodkas. A village dedicated to using Solar & Wind, not only for Burning Man, but all year long. We don't allow generators, so our village is fairly quiet. Anyone is welcome to sign up to camp with us. We DON'T have "DUES".

The AEZ is a generator free zone. If you like alternative energy, then welcome, you are invited to join our village of friendly folks. You will see and learn about solar panels, wind generators, solar ovens, solar showers, water cleaning, and meet people who can show YOU how to do this.

Maybe You Should Talk To Someone.name: Maybe You Should Talk To Someone

history.description: Our camp provides on-playa counseling services, offering burners a space to process emotions, navigate conflicts, and reconnect with their experience in a meaningful way. In addition to one-on-one support, we create opportunities for self-guided reflection through interactive spaces like a zen garden, a walkable labyrinth with an inspiration chest at its center, and a Zen Tent for journaling, art, and quiet contemplation. By blending therapeutic support with opportunities for introspection, our camp serves as a sanctuary for those seeking clarity, connection, and emotional renewal on the playa.

The Spanktuary is an immersive and inclusive camp dedicated to the exploration and celebration of the art of spanking within a consensual, respectful, and fun filled environment.  Our camp is a haven for enthusiasts of all experience levels, from the curious novice to the seasoned practitioner.  The Spanktuary offers a space where participants can delve into the multifaceted aspects of spanking.  We are committed to creating a safe, welcoming and judgment-free zone where individuals are encouraged to have fun as they explore their desires!  Equipped with various  accoutrements such as paddles, whips and bare hands,  participants can choose to spank or to be spanked. Have your spanking with bacon, whipped cream or a shot. A good time is in store for all! You will laugh your ass off!

We dream of gardens in the desert sand...are you curious?  Like a many petaled bioluminescent rose, we are a collective of multi-hemispherical curiosity seeking creators, engagers, go-getters, and contributors.  All are welcome to bask in our sweet scents and radiant fluorescence.  Visitors can expect a chill vibe, silly games, sweet treats, and maybe even a new playa name.

Our art support camp serves as the vibrant heart behind the powerful installation, "DROP," a monumental soft sculpture symbolizing purity, nourishment, and environmental consciousness. We provide a welcoming, inclusive community space dedicated to sustainability, creativity, and thoughtful conversations. Visitors are invited to engage with camp members, reflect on their relationship with nature, and participate in accessible arts and crafts workshops designed especially for children. Rooted in collaboration and inclusivity, our camp celebrates diverse voices, meaningful connections, and shared responsibility for the planet we pass on to future generations.

Follow the large lighted Palm trees at night and come enjoy a drink at the bar and ask about our daily activities that vary each day.

Too hot? Too Cold? Partied out? Need a break? Need a cuddle or two? or Ten?
You have come to the right place!

Come relax in our misted Dome and cuddle up in one of our large bean bags with 2 or 3 people. Get a refreshing tropical drink to rejuvenate senses and possibly participate in one of our daily dance lessons. Test your skills with one of our lighted hula hoops.

Come by in the early evenings for our daily activities related to dance instructions for Salsa, Swing, and Hula.   We will be doing body taping on Wed and Friday.  

Daily we will have morning  Yoga in the Dome at 10:00am starting Monday.   Coffee will be served 10:00 to Noon.  Thursday to Saturday we have Sunrise mini donuts with coffee served

Friendly neighborhood misting Parlor, Hair Salon and Bike Repair. Stop in and experience an overall cooling sensation from head to foot as you stroll through the mist. Come one, come all to celebrate everyday just like it's a holiday. We bring the spirit of celebration to the playa with our life-sized billiards game.
Beyond the game, our camp invites burners to engage with interactive installations:  
New Year's Resolution Board – Share your dreams and intentions for the year ahead.  
Love Letter Board – Leave anonymous messages of love and appreciation for fellow burners.  
Día de Muertos Wall – Honor and remember loved ones by adding their names and messages.  
Christmas Exchange – Leave a small gift, take a small gift—embracing the joy of giving.  

With glowing night games, themed challenges, and festive surprises, Misfit Island is a place to celebrate, connect, and play—one oversized shot at a time!
Come by Misfit Island and relax in our Chill dome or hang out around the fire. Always a good time with the Misfits!

JOBI: Coffee, Tea or Me? serves up fresh quality coffee, teas and hot cocoa every morning at 8:00 a.m. in our coffee lounge beneath a 30 by 10 by 10 Pergola filled with seated benches, rugs, pillows and a puppy pile.  C'mon by for coffee, community and conversation.

JOBI: Coffee, Tea or Me? serves up fresh quality coffee, teas and hot cocoa every morning at 7:00 a.m. in our coffee lounge beneath a 30 by 10 by 10 Pergola filled with seated benches, rugs, pillows and a puppy pile.  C'mon by for coffee, community and conversation.
Coffee, Tea and hot cocoa every morning at dawn (7:00 am); nighttime lounge area with staffed firepit, sofas, pillows and more. . .

JOBI: Coffee, Tea or Me? provides fresh brewed qualiity coffee, teas and hot chocolate and goodies every morning at 7 am after sunrise.  We also will be serving (new!) smoked meats three late afternoons in the middle of event week.
We also have a Lounge available 24/7, which is our Firelight Lounge every night from 8 - 12 with a staffed campfire.  The Firelight Lounge will also have a black coffee service to perk you up and send you on your way.
Depending on configuration we may also project our bliss lights onto a large black screen for a dance space every night.
If you come, plan to stay.  Our lounge is for you.  We like people who come for our offerings and stay to enjoy them.  People who come grab their beverage and split make us feel like we have cooties.

JOBI: Coffee, Tea or Me, serving coffee, tea, hot cocoa and treats every morning of the event from 7:00 till it runs out, plus (new this year!) a light immersion dance experience every night.  Bring your body, acoustic music, and don't forget your cup!

Coffee, Tea or Me?  JOBI provides coffee, tea, and hot chocolate (and other sweet treats) every morning after sunrise at 7:00 am.  Come join the conversation in our comfy sofas, rugs and pillows under a 30' long decorated and lit pergola.  Acoustic musicians welcome.

"Coffee, Tea or Me?"  Join us for fine coffee, teas and hot chocolate every day at 7:00 a.m. in our chill space with sofas, pillows and a firepit to warm your tush whether you are just getting up or on the glidepath down.

Good morning Black Rock City!  7 a.m. sunrise service of coffee, tea, hot chocolate (and "Me" if you ask nicely).  Coffee if you're getting up, tea if you played through, hot chocolate if you're feeling snuggly.  Sofas, pillows, rugs arranged under the big wooden structure arrayed with sparkly and flowing stuff.  Firepit if it's cold.  Stop by -- but always bring your own cup.
Offering coffee, tea and more every morning at 7 a.m. until it’s gone. . .
Sunrise coffee and tea service for those just getting up and those finally going down.

Spinny's Playground is a re-imagination of Sticky's Playground, a Burning Man camp designed to rekindle the childlike joy of physical challenge and play. As kids, we naturally tested our limits for fun, but as adults, we often lose that instinct, turning movement into a means to an end rather than a source of joy. At Spinny's, playfulness reigns through mega-sized playground structures, type-2 fun experiences, and extreme schoolyard games hosted by our Recess Hall Monitors. From 360-degree see-saws and a spinning bar to rope climbs and dance floors, we invite burners to rediscover the thrill of movement on the playa. Created by a passionate crew of artists, engineers, and dreamers from Reno, Nevada. We don't stop playing because we grow old—we grow old because we stop playing.

Sticky's Playground is a bountiful medley of opportunities to reclaim connection with your inner child as you swing from our monkey bars, climb our scaffolding, jump on the trampoline, or play on our world famous giant spinning teeter totter!

Sticky's Playground is a place where people experience the incredible satisfaction of doing things they didn't know they could do.  A place where playfulness and free energy are king and queen and come together in a  magical oasis! Visit Sticky's Playground to to tap into your inner child in this world of mega-sized playground structures, games, and transport you back to your schoolyard days when it was easy to have fun simply running in circles.

3SP (Third Space Place) is your dusty, comfy front porch/living room combo serving as a Black Rock City "third space" — a relaxing, community spot offering a real sense of welcome and belonging beyond one's dwelling ("first space") and one's workplace ("second space"). As with any true third space, guests can stop by, relax, ask for directions, chat, or PARTICIPATE in one of 3SP's events focusing on all kinds of issues: being introverted on Playa; navigating the world as a stutterer/stammerer; identifying unconscious biases; Native-American appreciation versus appropriation; relaxing with essential oils or a camera obscura mediation; and more. We've been around since 2015 and we've got campers from DC, NYC, Minneapolis, Philly, Portland, LA, and beyond. Come on by!

Camp P3: is a family, our family, misfits as they may be.  We believe in synergy, love, compassion, friendship, and that each morning should start with good coffee and/or a Bloody Mary. 

What does the P3 Stand for well you get to decide for some it's Princess Party Palace, for other Passionate Prometheans Stealing Playa Fire, Puros Pinchy Pendejos, Peoples Party Place, Purely Positively Perverse, or Perversion of Positive Perspective.  Each year at burning man our camp and each individual goes through a metamorphosis giving unprecedented access to and insight about the upper range of human experience.  Regardless of your definition Camp P3 it is incubating a movement to storm heaven and Steal Fire. It's a revolution of human possibility.

This year for the 8th year in a row, we be hosting the Wedding Dress March on White Wednesday! You must join us for our annual Wedding Dress Wednesday Parade! We start with ceremony to de-corks the first champagne bottle, followed with a group toast and a dancing procession to the chapel. Who gets married….does it really matter? We have dresses and champagne!  Do you like to play dress up?  Stop by and as one of our "fashion-istas" to dress your from our endless opportunities in our boutique!  Each morning we embrace the day with Nitro Coffee and a Bloody Mary Bar or join us for a spectacular evening of bourbon tasting.  One may stop by and see the "Now-A-Saurus", the most rare of mutant vehicles.

Do you like to play dress up?  Then come join us for our annual Wedding Dress Wednesday Parade.  Our very own Princes S. Stephanie kicks off our Annual Parade with a Champagne Toasts followed by a short dancing procession to the chapel.  Who gets married….does it really matter?  We have pretty dresses and champagne.

Come and gather at the Princess Palace. Our camp hosts Wedding Dress Wednesday with the Princess. We invite everyone to come play dress-up with Prince S. Stephanie.  We bring a closet of over 500+ wedding dresses for you to choose from.   We also host a Pink Panty and Pink Lemonade Bar where you can get a new pair of pink panties.  Or please choose to relax with one of our Morning Yoga Sessions.  Our camp is also home to the Steampunk Airplane Art Car "Deep Cycle".   Stop by only during the day.. because at night we are out dancing.

Our camp hosts Wedding Dress Wednesday with the Princess. We we invite the participates of BRC to come play dress-up with Prince S. Stephanie. We offer a parade that will begin someplace and end someplace. We will offer playa marriage ceremony officiated over by Reverend Mike. Is it leagal? - You may ask... Our answer... well meh... it could be. 

You can also grab a drink in our bar, spin the wheel of Safewords, and/or get a new pair of panties.

Welcome to your oasis on the playa! Kick back on our loungers, sip icy-cold refreshments that rotate daily, devour coconut pancakes, and get ready to make some bizarrely awesome connections. Whether you're speed-friending, shaking it at our parties, working up a sweat at our fitness class, or crafting your next artful masterpiece, there's no shortage of ways to unleash your creativity and meet new friends. With friendly people, chill vibes, and a whole lotta love, XOXO is all about making meaningful connections. We've got beats that'll get you dancing, interactivity that'll make you laugh, and an atmosphere that's pure magic. Come for the pancakes, stay for the vibes!

We are your lovely oasis in the heat of the Playa! Relax on our loungers in the shade, enjoy icy-cold drinks, munch on coconut pancakes as you learn at our expert lectures, and feel the love when you make new, unexpected connections in our space. XOXO soothes the weary desert traveler with cool beats, chill vibes, and lots of love all around!

Come to XOXO and recover from the regrets of last night. Don't dwell on them for too long – we need your energy!

Gigsville embodies decades of Burning Man history, mixing a spirit of playful anarchy with a deep commitment to inclusion. Renowned for our legendary fuckery, we create a space where creativity and rebellion flourish. Here, every form of individuality is celebrated, from seasoned burners to wide-eyed newcomers. Our ethos is built on challenging norms and embracing everyone with a penchant for mischief and a heart for community. Expect the unexpected: from mind-bending installations to spontaneous performances, all wrapped in our trademark humor. Gigsville: where history, hijinks, and heartfelt acceptance collide.

Gigsville is one of the oldest villages on the Playa (we're turning 26 this year, hooray!). We're dedicated to fire, fun, and good old fashioned jackassery. You'll find us gathered around the car that's on fire in the center of camp, probably arguing about whether or not ocelots should be allowed in camp, and whether or not that was, indeed, our camel.

Avoid gigsville at all costs as they celebrate their tenth consecutive year of utter and complete stupidity in black rock city. ask for a ride in the world famous car-b-que! enjoy polite, considerate conversation conducted at reasonable volumes at one of our many gathering spots. engage in deep theosophic discussion groups and yoga seminars at camp skynyrd. bring by an ocelot and watch what happens! here at gigsville, the movie never ends, it goes on and on and on and on!

Gigsville originally started as the whirligig village at Burning Man in 1998.  Since then, this community of over 300 people has become an active, year-round group of fuckos dedicated to the finer points of jackassery and better living through death.  All over the world you will find citizens of Gigsville, but their primary hangouts are in Northern and Southern California.

Gigsville is the whirligig village at Burning Man, established in 1998. Designed and built by its residents, we have had theme camps, events, and have tried to create a small freaky town atmosphere to the large city that is Black Rock City.

The community of Gigsville will be hosting its annual That Thing in the Desert retreat between August 29th and September 2nd 2002 in Black Rock City, NV. Come sing, dance or drop your pants! All participants welcome – Gigsville is a No Media zone.

Designed and built by its residents, we have theme camps, performances, art projects, events, and have tried to create a small freaky town atmosphere in Black Rock City. Gigsville has camped on the Esplanade at Burning Man for the last 3 years. In 2001 we plan to move back a few streets, increase our camping space, and let our creativity expand even further.

After last years success, Gigsville is ready to reign again. They have theme camps (Temple of Atonement, Gift Camp, Camp Skynyrd, The Delightful Paintbrush, Sandalla, Dish Camp, Pole Camp, Camp Digital, The Last Outpost, Storm from the East, Prom Camp), Interactive Art (Gateways, Dancing Gig-men, a Good Vibes VooDoo Doll), Public Games (Black Rock Electrical Parade, Gigsville Drag Races, He-man competition (to contrast), Radio Controlled Demolition Derby, Community potluck dinner, Homecoming Dance) and more! Based in Anaheim, CA

We're a camp that is a community on and off playa in our respective Bay Area communes and communities (aka intentional living communities). We come together to interact positively, do good for our greater community, and dream of ways of improving the way humans live together. We also come together to play, explore mischief and create shared narratives–or dare we say rumors.

A Burning Man theme camp dedicated to exploring our humanity, both as individuals and as a collective. Guests at our camp are encouraged to listen, think, and express their ideas for improving the human condition.

Come explore how to create a real-life utopia, take the stage for a music jam, sit down for a coffee date and connect with a perfect stranger, play the Life Size Game of Life, or simply join us for our nightly gratitude circles.

Prototopia gives you a space to come think, express, and communicate as humans with humans, while exploring what that means in the context of technology and artificial intelligence. Come share your ideas and stories of how to create a real-life utopia, sit down for a coffee date and connect with a perfect stranger, learn the 10 Burning Man Principles by interacting with our robot companions, or simply join us for our nightly gratitude circles.

At Empire of Dirt, we don't just build mutant vehicles — we launch dreams into orbit. Our camp is a hub of performance, creativity, collaboration, and full-on playa absurdity. We're proud to be a returning Burning Man camp based in Oakland, California, with a long tradition of mobile art, DIY ethics, and radical participation.

Interactivity is Our Mission

Our camp this year is inspired by the 2003 movie "The Triplets of Belleville."

Our installation will center around one scene in particular. In the scene, 4 Tour de France cyclists, abducted by the mafia, are smuggled into an underground gambling ring. Each cyclist is put onto a bike-like machine in front of a crowd of bettors. Each machine drives a miniature statue; the faster the cyclist pedals, the farther the statue goes along the "course". In the film, whenever a statue falls behind, the cyclist powering him is "taken out back" and you hear a loud bang. 

We'll be recreating this scene. You can ride up, hook up your bike, and see if you can get your horse to the finish line first. Any cyclists that fall behind will be "taken out back" and shot with a water gun.

To the side of the main event, we'll have a playa dome where cyclists can change into vintage jerseys. We'll even have an area for anyone who wants to shave their legs like a TRUE CYCLIST.

We will be serving Tea and Cookies… for tea and cookies.All you Polyamorous, poly-curious, and poly-friendly folks out there on the playa are invited to join us for a discussion about the practical issues of loving more than one in an open, responsible multi-person relationship. There are many workable forms of Polyamorous relationship – polyamory is polymorphic! There is much wisdom in the poly community which can be helpful to people trying to make *any* relationship work, monogamous or Polyamorous. There will be a facilitated discussion in which you can get your questions addressed and some of the knowledge in our community can be shared.

Breakaway Republic…Come take a break away from the fray and journey in to your own private evolving reality.  Write a letter or create a sketch or painting to mail on or off the playa to a friend or loved one, take home as a memento of your BM experience, or leave at the Temple to be burned.

Apo-the-neum (place of divine elevation) is a visual, sonic and haptic instrument intended to "transport" visitors through participatory immersion. Comprised of two nested chambers made of back-to-back LED nets (13,940 nodes in all), Apotheneum presents multiple canvases for collaborating visual artists and an immersive sound system for collaborating sound artists. Measuring 40 x 40 x 40 feet, Apotheneum's cubic antechamber envelops a thirty-foot "inner sanctum" that opens to the sky and is anchored by a 24-foot pressure-sensing "bed" on which visitors are invited to recline, and be transported.

At night, evoking aspects of the natural world—wind, fire, lightning, rain, stars, gravity, people and animals—Apotheneum encourages inward contemplation through multi-sensory somatic immersion.

Castra Ursi is pioneering a fully solar-powered, efficient, and inspiring camp model while showcasing the future of sustainable infrastructure on Playa.

This year, we bring The Ursas, two large, interactive, illuminated bear sculptures powered entirely by solar energy. Our camp will also serve as a hub for renewable energy education, offering a behind-the-scenes look at large-scale solar systems for camps and public art.

We are excited to promote the integration of art into the city, demonstrating how sustainable, interactive artworks can shape urban spaces. Through live demonstrations and discussions, we'll explore the future of fuel-free energy solutions at Burning Man and beyond.

Castra Ursi aims to lead and accelerate the future of what Burning Man's camps must become. It is a camp that is simultaneously efficient and comfortable, informative and inspiring, and one that is powered entirely by renewable energy.

Castra Ursi will provide public charging for participants' devices and small electric-powered mutant vehicles and will host several panels  engaging in topics specific to renewable energy on-playa and renewable energy powered public art.

Greetings, Starfighter. You have been recruited by the Star League to defend the playa against Xur and the Ko-Dan armada. Your dedication to building interactive art in a place so inhospitable is the challenge you have accepted. Clearly you have always wanted to fight a desperate battle against impossible odds. Provocations examining the intersections between humans and technology will be your focus and you have proven yourself skilled at mixing dust and electronics. Remember that no matter where you come from you can make difference. Trust Centauri on that one! Get our there! Build art! Be a hero. There really is no better place for you in the galaxy than an art support camp!

The Last Starfighter is an art support camp filled with lovers of science fiction. Stop by our porch if you need a good book for your burn or a good conversation about science fiction & futurism.  We are supporting the Augmented Reality Porta Potty's this year.  You may see us riding to and from deep playa on our ARP support bike.

Deaf Granny inhabits a vintage 1950s kitchen,  serving up goodies (and some baddies) in an interactive improv performance art format.  Sit and learn about visual communication and the particular ways of being exemplified by Deaf people.  Lovingly and  humorously she will confront and break down your preconceived notions, drawing you in as a participant actively engaged in your own awakening.  Also come and dance with us at our night time parties in our lounge.

Meet Deaf Granny, a little old lady inhabiting a vintage 1950s kitchen. She's serving up goodies (and some baddies) within a semi-improvisational interactive performance art project. Sit in her kitchen and interact with her and the satirical stereotype characters that surround her. Together, we will humorously confront and break down your preconceived notions and lovingly draw you in as a participant actively engaged in your own awakening to concepts and forms of visual communication and particular ways of being exemplified by Deaf peoples.  Sometimes we will order pizza.  Other times we have shots to share.  And don't miss our movie nights!  Oh, just come. We'll mess with your head and everyone will have a grand time!

Meet Deaf Granny, a little old lady inhabiting a vintage 1950s kitchen.  She's serving up goodies (and some baddies) within a semi-improvisational interactive performance art project.  Sit in her kitchen and interact with her and the satirical stereotype characters that surround her.  Together, we will humorously confront and break down your preconceived notions and lovingly draw you in as a participant actively engaged in your own awakening to concepts and forms of visual communication and particular ways of being exemplified by Deaf peoples.  Oh, just come.  We'll mess with your head and everyone will have a grand time!

Come hang out in this retro 1950s-era kitchen where you can meet Deaf Granny.  If she likes you, she might give you cookies and juice.  And she will make you laugh while teaching you some signs and cultural proclivities and a thing or two about communicating strictly in visual, as opposed to auditory, space.  If she is in the mood, maybe you will get PB&J or a shot of tequila.  Watch out, though -- if you're naughty, she may spank you and cuss you out in ASL or make you sweep the floor.  But never forget Deaf Granny loves you and you won't leave without a hug and stretched-out... comfort zone.

The Corral will be celebrating it’s 10th year on the playa – and we want you to help us celebrate in style!  Massive carved wood saloon bar, saloon hussies, cowboys and cowgirls, camp jail and daily playa virgin roundup – complete with OK Corral branding station!  Join us!
Once again the Corral is “bringing it” to the playa.  The Corral is known for their camp hotties, and trust me they have alot up their sleeves for 2009.

The Corral is one of the hottest destinations on the playa.  Sometimes called "Hot Chick Camp," we do our thing with day parties featuring some of the best djs we can muster, feed anyone and everyone, and create mayhem as much as we can. So saddle up and get ready for another memorable burn.
A cast of the wild wild west cowboys and cowgirls are poised to bring the fun(k) to you at our wacky corral.

IPOW-Indigenous People of World wants to bring Indigenous people and allies from around the world together to share their stories and life experiences. The basis of the camp is to create a place to share Indigenous culture and educate all who want to join our camp or events to learn. This camp will be a place to spread different cultures and teachings from all over the world for all that want to learn. We are honored by our Two Spirit community that support and are an integral part of our camp. The camp will be safe space for all Indigenous people for all over the world and allies. It is a place where people can learn and share traditions, foods before and after colonization, games, languages, and music. We will host interactivity events-based food and the gathering of people.

IPOW is a place to spread Indigenous culture, teachings, and help all who want to learn about who Indigenous people are and were. We would be honored if our Two Spirit community would be an integral part of our camp. The camp is safe space for all Indigenous people and allies. It is a place people can learn and share traditions, foods before and after colonization, games, storytelling, languages, and music. In 2023 the camp will continue the buffalo theme as "Buffalo Rising."

This camp will be a place to spread our culture, teachings, and who we were and are to all that want to learn. We would be honored if our Two Spirit community would be an integral part of our camp. Kentucky Fried Campers only need one spice, and that's the spice of life. And if you want some, join us any time of day or night. We begin each morning with the best hot breakfast in Black Rock City; a shot of good Kentucky bourbon served with a fried baloney sandwich. Afternoons you'll find us relaxing in our Olde Kentucky Dome, crafting, napping, music making, perhaps a bit of gossiping, and lots of just watching the Black Rock City whirled go by. Evenings are for dancing and more music making. Look for the KFC high in the sky and then spot our gingham-wrapped dome. Kentucky Fried Campers have been waiting for y'all!

Black Rock City's home for the best-damned breakfast in the Black Rock desert. Fried baloney sandwiches & bourbon shots served gingham style with a heaping helping side of Southern Hospitality.  You won't wanna miss the Whoreshoe Derby, Kentucky Fried Cotillion and late-night KFC Cock Fights in our olde Kentucky Dome!

We bring gentile Kentucky hospitality, combining elements of sweet down home with a sprinkling of agro/punk for spicing up the scene. Start your morning with a gourmet fried bologna sandwich to coat your stomach. Add a shot of KY Bourbon to rinse the Playa from your throat. Guests are welcome 'round the clock in our Old Kentucky Dome, with plenty of fun activities from yoga, spa treatments, crafting, storytelling, music playing, & just good ole socializing. Our dome is cool & shaded during the day & stocked with plenty of warm blankets & cuddle spots for cool nights in BRC. Everyone is welcome to join us mid-week at our illuminated Kentucky Fried Cotillion! Don't miss the fastest minute in BRC sports with the annual Whoreshoe Derby! HEYY!

The most festive breakfast on the Playa. Custom smoked then fried bologna sandwiches and shots of real bourbon served by some very enthusiastic and well dressed Kentuckians.
Bringing a hot breakfast of bourbon, fried baloney sandwiches, and Kentucky hospitality to the playa since 2007. KFC, it's what's for breakfast.

Kentucky Fried Camp - proudly serving the finest breakfast on the playa with the sweetest southern hospitality since 2000 something. Fried Baloney Sandwiches and fine Kentucky bourbon served up daily by gingham clad Kentuckians.

Your down home stop for a gingham clad hot breakfast, Kentucky hospitality, and fast paced playa racing. This year with extra Cotillion action.
Since 2008 bringing a hearty breakfast of Fried Baloney Sandwiches and Bourbon and a warm helping of Kentucky hospitality and charm to the people of Black Rock City.

And for yet another year Kentucky Fried will liven the mornings with Kentucky Bourbon and our delicious smoked, fried Baloney Sandwiches. We served over 2000 last year. What better way to start your day than getting Fried the KFC way! Starting 9 AM each day.

Kentucky has global recognition for a certain Kentucky Fried food franchise. When it comes to BEING FRIED nobody does it better than this camp of Kentuckians. We say the other  KFC is a bunch of baloney. Come join us every day from 9-11 for a good old fried baloney sandwich (our Black Rock version is actually smoked and pretty tasty) and a shot of bourbon to help you kick off your day the Kentucky Fried way.

Welcome to The Melon Motel, a vibrant oasis in Black Rock City where relaxation meets high-energy sound. By day, our shaded decompression lounge offers a refreshing escape with frozen facials, cooling face masks, and watermelon-infused water to help burners recharge. At night, the space transforms into a dynamic dance floor, featuring curated DJ sets from 10 PM to 6 AM with immersive lighting and an electrifying atmosphere. Whether you're looking to cool down, connect, or dance until sunrise, The Melon Motel is the place to check in and be part of the experience!

As longtime citizens of Black Rock City, we've seen how Burning Man catalyzes transformation in those who fully embrace it.

PlayAlchemist was born from a dream: to create a space that deepens this journey—a container for activation, co-creation, and personal alchemy.

Through immersive programming day and night, we foster exploration, introspection, and connection. At its heart stands the Pyramid—a 71-foot-high, 111-foot-base structure—both a crucible of alchemy and a beacon of higher consciousness.

Inside, participants journey through the seven stages of alchemy, while outside, the seven days of Burning Man mirror this transformation, uniting individual and collective evolution.

As citizens of Black Rock City for several years, we observed how the ingredients of Burning Man caused a transformation in all who experienced it. 

PlayAlchemist was born out of a dream to bring the gift of a campus designed to further enable deepening of this experience, a container for activation and co-creation of Alchemical personal transformation. 

PlayAlchemist contributes to the interactivity of Burning Man through immersive programming day and night, and the Pyramid is a physical representation of this crucible; of alchemy and of higher consciousness. 

Once inside this 71 ft high, 111 ft base great pyramid, you are initiated to embark on an internal journey of personal transformation through the seven stages of alchemy; while outside, the seven days of Burning Man unfold.

Transform yourself, transform the world. We are a Global community that extends far beyond the week at Burning Man. With over 20 hours of programming a day covering every topic under the sun, come see what we are all about and don't forget your dancing shoes!
Aligning with 7 days of Burning Man with the 7 stages of alchemy, join our growing community at PlayAlchemist to "Transform yourself, Transform the world."

EXPERIENCE RADICAL METAMORPHOSIS ON A JOURNEY THROUGH THE SEVEN STAGES OF ALCHEMY, IN SYNERGY WITH THE   SEVEN DAYS OF BURNING MAN.
Throughout history alchemy has been recognized as the process of transformation. This year at Burning Man we embark on our own journey as a community called PlayAlchemist.
EXPERIENCE RADICAL METAMORPHOSIS ON A JOURNEY THROUGH THE SEVEN STAGES OF ALCHEMY, IN SYNERGY WITH THE SEVEN DAYS OF BURNING MAN.

Welcome to the SoundCloud. Your cloud-themed portal to high-vibe frequencies and dreamy beats. We’re a crew of sound enthusiasts serving up elevated sounds from our cozy, cloud lounge. Float with us through ambient bliss, deep grooves, and healing vibrations on the fluffiest clouds in the multiverse.

We are an eclectic collective of sound therapists, healers, ceremonialists, psychedelic therapists, musicians, DJs, and sound enthusiasts, united by a deep love for vibration, frequency, and connection. From meditative sound journeys to soulful beats and heart-opening ceremonies, we offer a full spectrum of sonic experiences designed to uplift, align, and inspire.

At our dreamy cloud-themed lounge on the playa, you’ll find a sanctuary to relax, vibe, and recharge — wrapped in soft textures, loving energy, and surround-sound goodness. We also roam the dust in style aboard Claudius, our custom cloud art car, sharing healing frequencies and danceable grooves wherever we float.

Whether you’re seeking stillness, movement, or just good vibrations, SoundCloud is here to carry you — gently, playfully, and powerfully — on waves of sound and spirit.

Common Ground is a collaborative community of individuals from all walks of life, seeking to enhance the profound Burning Man 2015 experience with a variety of spiritual practices, primarily yoga and meditation. 

On camp site will be a large yoga tent, equipped with props, singing bowls and sound system. Common Ground will host 1 sunset and 1 sunrise daily classes on camp premises, of vinyasa, kundalini and restorative practices. Our Deep Playa Yoga Project will send out the camp's art car, The OMobile, to pick up interested yogis out into the depths of the desert for one pop up class at a random hour each day. 

The yoga tent will be available for meditation throughout the day, and an additional tent equipped with essential oils and Ayurvedic concoctions will serve as a massage parlor for all to enjoy.

Come experience Burning Man on many levels at Camp Touch This by climbing onto our 3- Story Cuddle Puddle and Lounge.  If you are afraid of heights, come dance it out with us at one of our afternoon frozen drink parties.

Stop by to climb the scaffolding and gain a different perspective on your day - or maybe your life, lock up a naughty friend in our camp jail, or dance it out with us at one of our afternoon frozen drink parties.

This misbehaving camp has fun planning adventures and misadventures all week. Do you have any naughty or misbehaving friends? If so, stop by and lock them up in the Camp Touch This Jail where you can get your mugshot and the full locked up experience. How will you post bail? CTT is the place to visit if you want to be locked up, take home a souvenir photo, or check out the creative kinetic bike sculptures.

This year Camp Touch This will be hosting the "Green Energy Strip Club". We will be harnessing the sexual energy provided by the erotic beauty of dancing females (volunteers). Aroused members of the audience will not be charged any kind of entry fee, but will be required to channel their heightened libido-state into physical motion that will provide the power to run the lights, music, etc, creating a beautiful and erotic space for the dancers to enjoy.

Allow your reach to exceed your grasp at Camp Touch This, where we are 1/2 dead-serious and 100% totally ridiculous. Flamboyant Freaks from Far into the Future embark to reintroduce you to your Jojobabacacalala. Find your way into our BlackLight Kiva-Dome to experience your transformation through the Art, Music, Dance and Improv of fellow Burners. A very specific Future Prediction will be made for you according to your “Asstro-Illogical Whore-a-Scope”. With your newfound courage, allow yourself to be served “Ginnerators” from the Popes at our “Pope & Beer” bar. With your newfound True Soul Design, and in the disguise of a Pleasant Mother Pheasant Plucker, allow us to guide you to the Beaches of Djibouti. Watch out for the Darth Vader Landscaping Crew and the High Priest of Uranus. Meet Discharged members of the BRC Military. Bring a suitcase with you from the default world of any “baggage” you may have, and together we will burn it all forever. All this taking place in the middle of the “Critical-need-for-Tits” bike parade – where we will again transform – this time into a gang of milk hungry oversized toddlers. Live in the moment, use your imagination and interact! Get crazy or be lazy.

Come for the coffee and stay for the fun! Test your skill on our 10' Hooker & Pegger game, enjoy an erotica reading, or throw a dildo to drench your buddy! Don't forget to take a complimentary porno mag while you're at it.

A JOURNEY OF TIME AND SPACE 
Galactic Cruzaders - the true international camp bringing in folks from all over the world.  Stop by for Wednesday Night cocktails in formal attire. Sit your ass down and get warm around the camp fire on every night. And stop by and listen to what our DJ's are spining, or join in with the live band when they play.

We make music and laughter and encourage you to drop by and pick up an instrument and jam with us on our stage atop the Galactic Cruzaders (a shool bus in her former life)!  Dance to our DJ lineup while enjoying an adult beverage from our bar on Tutu Techno Tuesday or sign up to strut your stuff in our Men in Lace lingerie fashion show.  Come one, come all, and help us make the magic that makes BRC our home in the dust!

Unleash your inner rockstar. Come jam on the roof of a psychedelic school bus everyday at sunset (6-9pm.) Musicians of all abilities welcome. You're in the band. If you just read this message you are officially a member of the band. Black Rock and Roll.
Black Rock & Roll every day at sunset. Pianos, guitars, bass, drums, synths, full PA system. We build the stage. You build the story.
LIVE MUSIC. Come jam into the sunset on the roof of a '93 School Bus. Electric guitars, banjos, bass, full drum kit. You want it, we got it. Black Rock n Roll.

Black Rock and Roll! Come jam on the roof of the Galactic Crusader as the sun sets on our fair city. 6PM daily. Electric Guitars, drums, bass, banjo, and more noisy toys. Play or party, drink and be merry.

Vibrations in the Desert offers a unique sound immersion experience designed to relax, ground, and awaken the senses. Our Vibration Lounge features specially designed beds equipped with built-in subwoofers that emit deep, resonant frequencies, creating full-body vibrations that promote mindfulness and presence. Visitors are invited to pause, tune in, and journey through curated soundscapes that inspire relaxation, clarity, and connection. Step into our space, close your eyes, and let the vibrations carry you to a place of inner balance.

Welcome to our hammock oasis, where ethereal visions of community unfold beneath the swaying sails of wonder and delight. Here, vibrant hammocks create a mosaic of color, gently cradling souls seeking solace and connection. Sunlight filters through, casting playful shadows while laughter dances on the breeze. Friends share stories and dreams, weaving together their hopes in a tapestry of shared moments. Aromas of herbal teas swirl around as spontaneous music resonates, inviting everyone to join in harmony. The atmosphere is charged with kindness, where creativity flourishes and inspiration flows like a river. In this haven, every heartbeat aligns, celebrating the beauty of togetherness and the magic that emerges when spirits unite with love.

In the heart of the desert, where dust dances with dreams, lies a hidden oasis known as the Hang-Out that embodies the spirit of the Burn. Here, souls intertwine amidst swaying hammocks and planted seeds awaken. Boundaries blur in this transcendent space. Desert winds carry ancient tribal beats and whispers of experiences to be found. 

Come, embrace the allure of this oasis, surrendering to the whispers of the desert. Experience our unique euphoria, enlightenment and a recharge of your soul and body.

it retreats into itself, an elusive camp providing nature's most relaxing environment—shaded hammocks, theopsiadelic as they rustle in the wind. In the language of ethereal syllables and innuendo, as individuals discuss the many adventures that have befallen them since they first set eyes on this dusty land. come find your respite…perhaps your soul.

Daytime on the playa is a hot affair, and finding a spot for a few comfortable moments can be a bit of a challenge. There is no better way to sail the dusty seas than nestled in one of the swaying hanging hugs that are the hammocks at the Hang Out. Strung elegantly from the support structure of the camp's sizeable shade structure, anchored to the mighty girth of the pre-apocalyptic Beast, our hammocks will provide you with the reset you need. Relaxing to the sounds of one of the best playlists on the playa (on the planet? Maybe?!), rejuvenate your soul in the company of the hardy and amiable souls that make the Hang Out one of the most quality, albeit perfectly simple experiences at Black Rock City.

The hammock is an ancient technology: simple and perfect. Tension, elevation, motion. Harmony between ground and air. A dusty burrito drifting through the continuum.  A great place to take a nap. Come ye unto the Hang Out.

After a long night of hunting vampires and dodging intergalactic marauders in the seedy spaceport known to some as BRC.  The glowing crystals that illuminate the city begin to fade as the Day Star climbs above the mountains.  It is time to rest.  From high and low, everyone knows that there is no better way to chill on the playa than a cool, shaded hammock.  Come ye unto the Hang Out.

The playa is a heavy load to carry, we know.  There is much work to do.  Inter-dimensional neverlands of sublime witchery don't just dance themselves into existence.  Someone has to stack the vibes.  Someone has to wire skulls onto shit.  And after a day/night/day of labors, you need to recharge.  Come ye then unto the Hang Out.

The hammock is an ancient technology, simple and perfect.  Tension, elevation, motion.  Perfect harmony between ground and air.  A dusty burrito drifting through the continuum.  The crucible wherein soulmates are alloyed.  A great place to take a nap.  Come ye unto the Hang Out.

Dozens of hammocks swinging in the playa breeze filled with dusty desert nymphs, lost souls, Gargarean bards, and past patrons. Come tip your cup; light a hooka; swing in the Bird Cage while singing a song; loose a day to our special version of Nirvana; find your inner child (or even a lost one); we offer all these things and more.

Hammock you say?! Check! Shade? Check! In-the-know? Check! Bards, poets, dusty-nymphs, lost souls, found children and your inner child. We also offer dirty-deeds,  innuendos, propositions, desert quests, random libations, and a visual euphoria for that recently opened third eye. There’s more than one way to catch a sparkle pony…let explore what lies beneath those dusty layers!!!

Black Rock City Animal Control.  Keeping the play safe from bunnies and other pesky animals since 2001.  
Home of the Tiki Tank art car too!

We proactively go out and play practical jokes on attendees.
We've been capturing people dressed like animals on playa since 2001 and have been losing a battle against the increasing bunny population...our mortal enemies.
We also are the original "You Won Burning Man" porto-potty prank, starting in 2002.  We've done "Tequila Pit Crew" (dressed as a pit crew timed how fast can you run in and lay down and have us feed you beer and tequila), "Demolition Enforcement Agency" (we had a wrecking ball art car and would service notices to camps then pretend demo them with fake dynamite by doing a countdown that ends in a dance number.  We've dressed as matadors to mess with cyclists and we hung fake security cameras in your showers last year.  Lots more  new shenanigans planned for this year as well.

Since 2001, Black Rock City Animal Control (BRCAC) has tagged and inoculated countless playa "animals," keeping the streets of Black Rock City safe and secure for all residents. BRCAC also continues its commitment to interactivity on playa with playful schticks residents have come to love such as Tequila Pit Crew, Chapstick Commandos, Bad Idea Camp, Morning Matadors, and BRCAC's quest to find the "Winner" of Burning Man with Trophy Camp.

Since 2001, Black Rock City Animal Control (BRCAC) has tagged and inoculated countless playa animals. Safety and security from wild and rabid animals are our promises to you. BRCAC also continues to act out all over playa with playful shticks you’re come to love such as Tequila Pit Crew, Chapstick Commandos,  Bad Idea Camp, and our quest to find the “Winner” of Burning Man with Trophy Camp.

BRC Animal Control will make collections of those pesky playa creatureswho are running free causing disturbances to camps, streets and or persons ofthe City. These captured animals will be documented and tagged for scientificresearch and easy recognition.  Some animals may need to be spayed/neutered orgiven shots.  Our trained staff will use the latest in animal reform practicesto allow these potentially dangerous animals the chance to be reintroduced tolife on the playa.  If our staff concludes that an animal has achieved reformedstatus they will be released and may have the opportunity to be adopted by/auctioned to a responsible Black Rock City citizen OR released to the playa in its natural habitat.

COME PLAY!! Grow old, not up. By day rest in our shady lounge and hydrate, color, knit, play games and talk. After dark, lose yourself in our 3-D black-light experience! Come flow to some vibey tunes, create a visual masterpiece on our Giant Bright Light, and warm yourself at our campfire. Join us late on Thursday night for 'Elvis Hour' around 8 pm followed by a night of music with words through the decades and psychedelic rock. Friday we welcome ALL for our annual Shabbat potluck at sundown - bring some food to share or simply come and enjoy! We dig high fives, interpretive dance, and hula hoops, meaningful conversation, and old-school burners. WELCOME HOME! We've missed you. Let's share and play.

GROW OLD, NOT UP! By day we offer a shady place to lounge, hydrate, color, and play. Gentle yoga in the AMs. After dark, immerse yourself in our 3-D blacklight experience - flow to some vibey tunes, create a visual masterpiece on our Giant Lite Bright, and get warm at the campfire. Join us till late on Thursday night for the 4th Annual 'Elvis Hour' around 8pm followed by a night of 'music with words': tunes through the decades and psychedelic rock of yesteryear. Friday we welcome ALL for the 5th Annual Shabbat Potluck at sundown - bring some food to share or simply come and enjoy! We dig high fives, bad jokes, hula-hoops, and nerdy knitters. Catch a ride on the The Waving Jelly Art Car or grab a book from the Lie-Barry. Up is down at this janky camp. COME PLAY, we've missed you!

ALL ARE WELCOME AT BHLS!! Grow old, not up. We're offering a shady place to lounge and hydrate, color, knit, find some conversation and maybe Ask a Psychedelic therapist your burning questions. After dark, immerse yourself in our 3-D blacklight experience and create a visual masterpiece on our Giant Lite Bright installation. Come join us on Thursday for Elvis hour followed by a night of music with words and Friday for Shabbat potluck at sundown. We dig high fives and hula hoops. Conversation and bad dad jokes. WELCOME HOME! Let's play.

ALL ARE WELCOME AT BHLS!! 'Where fact goes in and fiction comes out'. We are kids at heart- here to offer a shady place to lounge and hydrate, color and make art, have spontaneous jam sessions, and create oversized origami fortune tellers. At night, immerse yourself in our glowing 3-D Blacklight Experience tent and create a visual masterpiece on our Giant Lite Bright installation. We like high fives and hula hoops. Conversation and silly faces. Welcome home! We can't wait to see you!

Come hang out with us! At Black Hole Literary Society, we provide good times day and night, activities for the young and the forever young including: "adult"-ish color and chill zone, life size Lite Brite, conversation and rest by day, and music, play, and black lights by night! Shabbat pot luck.

Black Hole Literary Society, a theme camp for all ages, features a black light interactive art gallery with 3D glasses available to participants upon entry at night, a 24 hour coloring book and chill zone for all ages, and a life-size Brite Light interactive art installation. Come play with us! Enjoy the shade, some cold H20, great conversation, and make new friends!! Can't wait to see you at home )'(
Black Hole Literary Society provides an interactive black light art gallery and chill space in addition to a coloring tent and trampoline. Drop by for good vibes day and night.

Red Nose District (RND) has been in existence, in one form or another since 1998. In 2013, we resolved to keep our hearts, minds, and noses RED from now until the end of time! RND has roots and participants in LA, SF, Santa Fe, NYC, Las Vegas, Pacific NW, Canada, Israel, France, & various states & countries around the world. Our members are involved in (or are lovers of) the circus arts, & work to bring our skills & talents to the playa in forms that allow for immersive & participatory experiences for citizens of Black Rock City. Notable past projects/activities include: High Chair Stilt Bar, PedalBump, Muse, Fire Wire, Wheel of Fortune, Zenobia Blanca stilt limo, Mega Mega, Bounce Back, stilt lessons, 30' swings, & circus variety shows of all forms! Come find us on the playa!

Red Nose District History, background: Red Nose District (RND) has been in existence, in one form or another, since 1998. In 2013, we resolved to keep our hearts, minds, and noses RED from now until the end of time! RND has roots and participants in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Santa Fe, Oregon, Canada, Israel, France, and various states and countries around the world. Our members are involved in (or are lovers of) the circus arts, and work to bring our various skills and talents to the playa in forms that allow for an immersive, participatory experience for the citizens of Black Rock City. Notable past projects/activities include: High Chair Stilt Bar, Pedalbump, Muse, Fire Wire, Wheel of Fortune, Zenobia Blanca stilt limo, Zeppelin art cars, afternoon stilt lessons, the Stoop, Whiskey Kickball, and circus variety shows of all forms!  Want to know more?  Come find us on the playa!

For 19 years The Red NOse District has aimed to provide a place for the citizens of BRC to find the joy of Play without reservation. Giving all a reason & the support of family to get physically engaged, dressed up silly & laugh,  providing a feeling that is hopefully taken away & made part of every day life back in the default world.
FUN = Funny 
           Unique
           Nutty!! 
Stilts, Swings, a DIY Stage, Shade for laid back heckling, Fire Sculptures to snuggle up next to for Intimate nighttime Giggling, High Chair & Low Top Bars with Themed Cocktail Parties, Playground Gear Shenanigans Adult Style, Lessons & Movie Nights...
Come Visit, Learn, Play & Laugh, who knows you might wanna move in with us!  

https://www.rednosedistrict.com

Red NOse District is your Go~To STILT BAR & Front Stoop~like Entertainment & Kick Back Zone. Come to us to; learn to Walk Tall & get high  to get drunk or get real low to get tipsy @ our Big & Small Top Bars for Sunset Themed Costume Cocktail Parties....be fully entertained by professionals or throw down DIY style on our Stage in front of our Gong Show Lounge Crew....snuggle up by our Fire Sculpture Garden...or Kick Dawn's Balls in a game of Whiskey Sunrise Kick Ball...

The Red Nose District is an interactive camp.  Come and enjoy our Pedal-powered bumper car track, sidle your stilted (or non stilted) self to our High Chair Stilt Bar and relax in the majesty of The Stoop in a friendly open community and a welcoming family for anyone who wants to be part of the fun. And what carnival-esque world wouldn't be complete without puppet shows?

It’s the return of the Red Nose District! Join us under the Big Top Tent for pedal-power bumper cars, high-wire hilarity, the Klownge, daily sunset themed costume cocktail parties at the stilt bar and low-rider minibar, fire sculptures, the notorious reclining esplanade peanut gallery, a performance stage for live music and all manner of carnival chaos.

Behold the Red Nose District, home to a mighty indie circus, performance and comfort collective comprised of Cirque Berzerk, Gooferman, Vau de Vire Society, the EnHightened Beings of Leisure, and Waffling Waystation. Shows Tuesday through Saturday nights, and daily afternoon world music dance parties, midway amusements, happy hour, and waffle breakfast, all open to the public.

Behold the Red Nose District, home to a mighty indie circus, performance and comfort collective comprised of Cirque Berzerk, Gooferman & Circus Metropolus, the EnHightened Beings of Leisure, Fringe, and TOTEM Massage and Chill. Shows Tuesday through Saturday, midway amusements, happy hour daily.

Behold the hope of the awake, the fear of those who sleep, the kaleidoscopic future of circus: the Red Nose District! Take a deep breath and dive into a wondrous world of intoxicatingly delicious performance, music, and art, the likes of which Black Rock City and the rest of this fine globe have never before been.

Vessels of Love is a sanctuary for the soul, offering a space of deep connection, healing and nourishment. We aim to be a calming space that can soothe friendly souls. Our sacred healing dome hosts shamanic rituals and heart-opening ceremonies. We also provide healing Amazonian elixirs and wholesome foods such as superfood popcorn to uplift the body and spirit. Step into the vessel and surrender to the flow of love.

Get ready for a wild ride with Happy Hanuman, the grooviest mutant vehicle support camp around! We're a global crew of creative crazies, zooming in from every corner of the planet to unleash our wacky imaginations on the Playa with some seriously epic Mutant Vehicles. But wait, there's more! Our camp is packed with fun goodies for you to explore—like our totally awesome calligraphy wall! Picture this: a giant white canvas where you can splash, scribble, and paint with water that magically vanishes as it dries. Swing by, say "hi," and let's make some Playa magic together!

Tierra Bomba brings a Latin American flair with a kick to the playa, infusing it with spicy flavors that transport you to a vibrant oasis. Our camp embodies the spirit of Latin hospitality, aiming to foster connections and create magical moments for all who gather under our roof. With open hearts and arms wide open, Bombito's mission is to share our unique blend of Latin culture with the Burning Man community, embracing everyone with the mantra: "Mi casa es tu casa."

Fueled by the energy of Latinos, heavily influenced by Colombian roots, Tierra Bomba is a camp that embraces diversity with open arms. We welcome people from all corners of the globe, including Mexico, Argentina, Italy, France, Turkey, Ghana, Pakistan, and beyond, creating a melting pot of cultures and experiences.

Lost Highway is an immersive experience where participants can discover the story of an old, dusty stretch of desert highway that mysteriously disappeared in 1959. This Lost Highway, full of roadside attractions of the era, finally reappeared complete with paranormal, trippy, vintage, and sun baked sights. It's a time capsule from a bygone era, but then the more you look, the more things seem to be a little different…

rEVOLUTION is both a high energy camp and a chill camp.  We believe that through evolution, we can create a revolution.  We reserve the right to change, to be agents of change and to commit to the Burning Man principles each time we return after our revolution around the sun.  We offer food, beverages, healing through Gamma Breath Work, opportunities to communicate with anyone and fun through dance.  West Coast Swing and Martinis.  Hot dogs, Chili Cheese Dogs, Veggie Dogs, and Gin & Tonic.  We feed your body, soul and sense of freedom.  There are no requirements to visit us, only the ability to participate, act on immediacy and be open to both revolution and evolution.

The Leftovers is a group of veteran burners who feed and quench the thirst of residents of Black Rock City.  What do we offer?  Hot Dogs!  Adult Beverages!  Great conversation, dance, music and a place to relax!

The New Barbarians are a community of friends that have been burning since 2012. Together we've grown into a barbaric empire of misfits mostly based on the west coast.  We look forward to another amazing year where we will yet again get to contribute and we invite the community to our events, which offer yummy food, shade, cold beer, sweet tunes, engaging talks, fun activities, and warm welcomes.

What we do know gives us solace.  The New Barbarians, led by their massive steel ruler, Jurassic Pork, have returned and are on a quest to protect human life and spread their bountiful stock of delicious wieners to the mouths of hungry burners.

According to folklore, Ulysses and his crew in their stupor of greed were in search for riches and were blown off course to land at Circe's island.  Ulysses crew was taken to meet Circe upon their arrival in which Circe concocted a drink made from barley and herbal remedies.   Only one refused the drink, Eurylochus, all others experienced METAMORPHOSES and turned to PIGS.  

Be brave barbarians! For one wrong drink and you may metamorphoses into the shape of your ruler, JURASSIC PORK. 

How will you serve JURASSIC PORK in new forms this year?

Moving beyond the confines of a traditional food camp, The New Barbarians quest to provide subsistence and endless comfort in a desert land full of desire, self-discovery, and radical transformation.  Come join our barbarian tribe from 1-2:30pm daily to participate in our dusty savage nourishment project!

Like if Cheers and Paddy's had a baby bar, except without the homophobia, misogyny and casual racism.

There are four kinds of knowing: what you know; what you think you know, but don't; what you know you don't know; and what you don't know you don't know. We're here to rearrange all four. From tasty cocktails to help you forget what you know to workshops and salsa dancing lessons to help you figure out the things you don't. For everything else in between, follow along with our year round Burning Man acculturation series: Shit You Should Know.

Fake Moon Factory is an international team of Burners dedicated to bringing art to Burning Man. Led by Australian artist Clayton Blake, the team has contributed monumental art to the event for four years, including the iconic "Perpetual Consumption" shopping cart sculpture in 2018. They have since exhibited significant artworks like "Containerisation" (2019), "Toxic" (2022), and the 26ft stainless steel rocket "Odyssey" (2023). In 2025, they return with their most ambitious project yet, "Vertica", a monumental, inhabitable, stainless steel sculpture that explores themes of progress, ambition, and the complex risks inherent to modern society.

Fake Moon Factory is an international team of extraordinary Burners working together with Australian artist Clayton Blake, to bring art to the playa. 
We have exhibited the iconic shopping cart sculpture titled "Perpetual Consumption" (2018), shipping container sculpture "Containerisation" (2019), and inflatable ball sculpture "Toxic" (2022).
Last year we created a 26ft stainless steel inhabitable rocket titled "Odyssey" (2023). 
Beyond the art, we had a nightly "launch" performance on playa and held artists talks daily in our camp hosting other prominent BM artists.
We are excited to be back in 2024 with our most ambitious project to date, "Sanctum". A 30ft tall inhabitable and interactive sculpture guaranteed to challenge and inspire.

Sozo Experience is open for those looking for inner or outer healing, and for those wanting more of the supernatural! We offer venerative and regenerative meditation, drum circles, spiritual readings, healings, and an experimental "Dopamine Dump" experience. So get some caffeinated exotic coffee with us in the morning, or come to afternoon thought provoking and interactive workshops on desert survival, or exploring the unseen world. Our crew is from the fabulous Chai Lounge-so if inclined, join us for a truth ceremony, or check out the menu board of spirituality!

We serve desert-friendly non-alcoholic teas and sherbets, along with exotic sweets and treats tried and true favorites from thousands of years of Iranian / Persian desert living and culture.

Finally, what you've been waiting for! A Burning Man Camp that reimagines the little-known historic phenomenon of pleasure dairies! Think Marie Antoinette but in the Wild West. A place where you can never have too many cows or cow puns. At high noon be udderly refreshed by dairy-alternative craft cocktails at our bar, The Tits, and spend some time in the shade nourishing your connections at our message-in-a-bottle service. After sundown, explore our LED cactus garden and kick up your boots in our cozy lounge. Moo-la-la!

We will also offer sunglasses and other needy items for the playa.

We are a salty group of river rats who got eddied out for far too long and have lost our way.... We dally, role play, keep people from getting where they want to go, lure them in with bait, take them fishing, compete in games and generally keep them going in circles. Where were you going? No one knows... got eddied out a while back!

AdramaNation is an all inclusive and diverse camp focusing on a drama free and fun filled burn.  Engaging workshops, delicious delicacies, hydration, art, weddings, burnercise, and good company are to be found with us.  Whether you need a safe space to escape your drama or a place to meet new friends, you're always welcome here.

AdramaNation offers a well spring of peace and tranquility.  Get cleansed, get married, get hydrated, and/or release your drama at our Drama Dump/ Wedding Chapel/Tea Emporium.

Got drama? Dump it here and receive a release.  Spent all of your wedding money to come to Burning Man?  Get married at home on the playa! Legal weddings in a drama free zone.  You must contact us 6 weeks ahead of time to ensure we get all paperwork for NV laws.

AYA OASIS is a sanctuary of connection, play, and transformation on the Playa.

We offer two realms: Tea Oasis for mindful brews and soul-deep conversations, and Nawi Oasis for nights of tribal rhythms and Afro-infused beats.

Here, we gather wanderers, dreamers, and creators to awaken hidden archetypes through music, ritual, and shared moments.

Our camp is a family where everyone contributes, supports, and inspires.
Come for the tea, stay for the vibes, leave transformed.

The Reno Housewives return to Burning Man again this year, bringing with us obnoxious clothing, cocktails, our ever-growing collection of refrigerator magnets, and local tips about visiting the Biggest Little City in the World. This year, we are also inaugurating the “Russ Berrie Timeless Temple of Wuv” – come spin a “Wuv” prayer wheel and light a candle for the one you wuv!
Reno Housewives: come sit by the trailer & chat with the reno village locals! Bring a fridge magnet from your hometown & trade them while hearing stories of our alien encounters.

Serving mid-high end whiskey at our funky little bar.

We are a Whiskey Theme Camp with a habitual yoga problem, as we like to joke.

As a volunteer based camp with high participation, we have offered events and classes such as Yoga, Goth Night, @Bar Martini Lounge, Hand Jobs, and more. Also, we have been blessed to be called home by the Ma'am the Mammoth Mutant Vehicle and the Mushroom Patch Art Car.

We are a Whiskey Theme Camp with a habitual yoga problem, as we like to joke. Besides providing mi-high range whiskey, we offer various classes, serivces and events like Tango, hand care and much more. Come check out out Burnopoly Board and stay for the whiskey.

We are a Whiskey camp with a small habitual yoga problem. 
Our concept is simple. Capitalize on what the Burning Man community desires more of (Art, yoga, classes, themed nights, events and whiskey). At the same time, be challenging and creative to show the community something; anything that is new and different.
