MOOP Map HQ is Playa Restoration's home base — part LNT response center, part history hub, part hangout. We're like a firehouse for MOOP, ready to roll out when there's an issue. It's also where you'll find past MOOP Maps, interactive displays, and friendly faces happy to chat about Leave No Trace or how to join the Resto crew!

Home of the Playa Restoration All-Star team (aka Resto), this is where we spring into action, responding to environmental cleanup emergencies and coloring in the MOOP Map in real-time. Interested in volunteering to Leave No Trace with Playa Restoration after the event? Come to Esplanade at 5:30 and hang out with Resto by our Fireside Circle and sign up to leave the playa clean, beautiful, and without a trace.
MOOP Map HQ: Headquarters of The Playa Restoration All-Star Team and the MOOP Map! LEAVE NO TRACE!
MOOP Map HQ: Home of The Playa Restoration All-Star Team

Moop Map HQ is the Playa Restoration Staff Camp featuring Leave No Trace Interactivity and Education

• SEE The Leave No Trace Show where our fearless Resto Crew break things on the playa in front of a live audience just so they can clean it up!
• VISIT our MOOP Map Museum where you can see all of the past years MOOP Maps and how we've evolved!
• Experience our Moop Gardens and learn about the most common types of MOOP on the playa!
• View photos from past event site Restoration operations!
• Get familiar with the tools used to Leave No Trace on the Playa!
• Get warm by our Fireside Circle!
• Join the Team and Leave no Trace!

Moop Map Headquarters is the Playa Restoration interactive education camp.

• Visit the Moop Gardens, learn about the most common types of Moop found during Playa Restoration.
• View GPS data and photos from past event site Restoration operations.
• Get familiar with the tools used to Leave No Trace on the Playa.
• See every Moop Map 2006 – 2017 on display.

Swing by and take a trip into TOMORROW aboard The Galactic Terrapin. Or, better yet, catch a ride home from Deep Playa after a late night out, or early morning in(side). Hope to see you all on the SLOW side of the pond!
Come one, come all. Relax in the shade, take a ride on The Galactic Terrapin or dance the night away under the disco lights. The Galactic Terrapin departs nightly, 1 hour before sunset.

Welcome to Mona Camp, where the spirit of caring, loving, and creativity thrives amidst the vast expanse of the playa. As part of the same community that brought you the Huge Mona Bunny in 2023 and the enchanting Mona Mushroom in 2024, this year we are bringing MONA DIE! DIE! DIE! and are dedicated to spreading the Mona spirit far and wide.

We believe in the power of art to inspire, connect, and uplift souls. Our theme revolves around celebrating art and mushrooms. 

Join the Million Mushroom March where everyone who identifies as mushroom (or has mushroom inside of them) will dress up as their favorite fungus and parade from Center camp to Mona Mushroom. We'll have workshops from legendary mycologists and neuroscientists beforehand.

Regnum Animalia finitur. Regnum Fungi surgit.
Grass Palace is an Art Support Camp that is in training to become a fully grown theme camp in future years. Look for the bamboo towers and wild people in imminent jeopardy - there you'll find us.

We are Borg is home to the BORG Cube, a solar-powered, all-electric mutant vehicle shaped like a glowing cube of alien tech. Our camp blends sustainability, art, and engineering through low-impact, immersive design. Nearly all of our infrastructure—lighting, sound, and power—is battery-powered and solar-fueled. Visitors can relax in our shaded lounge, enjoy music, and explore clean energy solutions.
Art support camp for Ninja Pizza

Welcome to *D*R*E*A*M* Immerse yourself in a cloud-like oasis of creativity and serenity. Our camp is a haven for dreamers, artists, and visionaries from around the world. Join us in a space where radical inclusion and artistic expression flourish. Experience immersive art, wellness offerings in our dream cloud. Be part of a community dedicated to personal and planetary growth, embracing the beauty of simplicity. Explore new dimensions with us at Burning Man 2024

Our campmates come from all over the United States - Boulder, CO; Park City, UT; Jackson Hole, WY; Detriot, MI; Seattle, WA; Albany, GA: and Los Angeles, CA.
Camp Connection is an art support camp.  We support two art pieces on the playa - Centered by artist Darrell Ansted and Take Flight by artist Cindy Allen.  We are based out of Boulder / Denver, CO.
The connection we make with each other is the most important thing in this life.  We invite you to connect with us through interactive play and a willingness to be vulnerable.
An oasis for dreamers, dancers and wonderers. Come chill, dance or play some tunes with us.

Areola 51 is where the grand universe meets the mighty nipple! We offer a fun experience that combines radical self expression with tactile art in a lightly kink format. Playans paint their (or a friend's) nipple with any design they choose, then press that design onto canvas and have it framed by one of our specialists! After they sign it, take the art home or put it on display in our Boobseum!

Break something? We'll try to fix it! No promises, other than you'll leave with something and we'll have a good time trying. Power tools and expertise available Office Hours, otherwise 24/7 DIY with hand tools, work space, and plenty of materials to MacGyver your issue. No bikes or mutant vehicle help, though we'll try to point you in the right direction.

Whirl of Art team brings to the playa a whimsical art installation of multi-tower kinetic art sculptures set into motion by burners playing on a merry-go-round. Its a collaborative project of dozens of amazing artists from different Texas cities. Come activate your inner child and play on the playground of the Whirl. Stop by our art support camp to meet the artists and builders behind the project.

The Airpusher camp is the port from which our fantastical airship begins and ends her voyages.  Join us for music and joy.  Check our event schedule and meet us at camp prior to our published airship rides to playa and beyond.

Airpusher Collective brings our iconic Steampunk Airship to the playa every year.   We celebrate love, art and music. This collective of visionaries believes in the power of community and creativity, of collaboration and inclusion, of fun and silliness. Our passion lies in creating memorable experiences with our art and music. You can find us creating and celebrating on the Playa, at our home-grown parties in San Francisco like the Steampunk Masquerade or more intimately at our monthly FlyBy Happy Hours.
Airpusher Collective:  We celebrate love, art and music. This collective of visionaries believes in the power of community and creativity, of collaboration and inclusion, of fun and silliness.

Airships were one of the first crafts built to bring mankind up into the clouds, and Airpusher's Steampunk Airship is bringing this experience to Burning Man with a twist. It's a place for you to dance, laugh, stargaze, and get a breath of fresh air underneath the illuminated balloon of a classic airship.

Airpusher: the Steampunk Airship brings an aural and visual experience making you feel as though you are flying through (and dancing on!) the clouds! We are sharing this experience with the community at Burning Man 2015; creating a space for DJ's to spin, dancers to dance, laughers to laugh, cuddlers to cuddle -all happening underneath the massive, illuminated balloon that "carries" us across the playa!

Airships were one of the first crafts built to bring mankind up into the clouds and now Airpusher’s Steampunk Airship is bringing this experience to Burning Man in 2014 with a twist. It’s a place for you to dance, laugh, stargaze, and get a breath of fresh air underneath the illuminated balloons of a classic airship. Airpusher presents a new haven for DJs, musicians, aerialists and performance artists alike to showcase their talent on the playa.
Superman's Fortress of Solitude Art Car camp.

Swizzle Me Timbers is your tropical oasis in the desert—serving up sunshine, sass and sensational spirits during our afternoon happy hours. We specialize in playful pours like tiki concoctions, rum tastings and boat drinks, shaken with a wink and a twist of lime. No late-night ragers here—just daytime delight and breezy vibes before the burn kicks into overdrive. In the spirit of Tomorrow Today, we're building a future where connection is stirred, not shaken—and the only thing fake is our pirate accents.

Burners Without Borders is celebrating our 20th Anniversary!
Our camp in Black Rock City (BWB-BRC) is a physical manifestation of our mission and community. We seek to bring together do-ers, makers, and change agents who bring the 10 principles to life beyond the orange trash fence. We do this by hosting a speaker series, a maker space, evening conversations around the fire-pit and supporting the participant-facing BRC sustainability teams like BLAST, RAT, and the Green Corridor.

BWB promotes activities around the globe that support a community's inherent capacity to thrive by encouraging innovative approaches to disaster relief and grassroots initiatives that make a positive impact.

Burners Without Borders (BWB) camp is a home for participants involved in community resiliency, social impact, and civic activation projects around the world. We host talks, workshops, a maker space and a nightly fire to bring together our community and create new friendships.

The ARTery is the headquarters of the Burning Man Art Department on playa, located at 6:30 and Esplanade in Black Rock City. It functions as a hub for information about art, as well as a check-in and resource center for artists, helping to  facilitate the placement and installation of their art on the playa during the Burning Man event.
The Burning Man Art Department's headquarters in Black Rock City. Home of the ARTery, Art Support Services (ASS), Fire Art Safety Team (FAST) and Eyes on Art.

The home to the ARTery, Burning Man's Art Headquarters on playa and Everywhere, a point of connection between Black Rock Citizens and off-playa, worldwide Burning Man-related projects and culture. Come learn about and connect with off-playa Art and Civic Engagement programs, the Regionals Network and Burners Without Borders as well as meet other like-minded burners to discuss year-round Burning Man culture in the world.

Lamplighters! Longest running performance art on Playa. Come help us help YOU! Lamplighters light the city every night of the event so YOU can get home safely. We throw a volunteer party everyday at 5pm, and light the city after that.

The Lamplighters began in 1993, with a small group of participants placing a dozen or so kerosene lanterns on the ground each evening, illuminating a pathway towards The Man. 

The Lamplighters are more than a handful of volunteers; they are a team of well over 100 participants every evening. To accomplish this considerable task, we ask for your help, and we invite you to be a part of this community, this event, and our tradition. 

The Lamplighters begin EVERY EVENING of the event in their center camp workspace at around 5pm. The ceremony begins around 6, and soon the work is done. No experience is required. We welcome virgin and seasoned burners alike. One thing is certain though. We can't do it without YOU.

The Lamplighters are more than a handful of volunteers; they are a team of well over 100 participants every evening of the festival. And the dozen or so lanterns from 1993 have grown to nearly 1000. To accomplish this considerable task, we ask for your help, and we invite you to be a part of this community, this event, and our tradition. Before the event closes, after The Man burns, more than 1000 people will have helped the Lamplighters accomplish their important work.

The Lamplighters begin EVERY EVENING of the event in their center camp workspace at around 5pm. The ceremony begins around 6, and soon the work is done. No experience is required. We welcome virgin and seasoned burners alike. One thing is certain though. We can't do it without YOU.
Come volunteer any or every day at 5pm with The Lamplighters and help light the city! We also have a party every day at 3pm.
Lamplighters, longest running project on the Playa. Come over everyday at 5pm to help light OUR city!
Lamplighters, longest running project on the Playa. Come over everyday at 5pm to help light OUR city!

The Lamplighters begin EVERY EVENING of the event in their center camp workspace, Lamplighter Chapel, at 5pm to prepare lanterns to light the streets of Black Rock City. The parade and ceremony begins around 6PM. No experience is required. We welcome virgin and seasoned burners alike. One thing is certain though. We can't do it without YOU.
Come be a part of the longest running art project on the playa. Come down to center camp at 5pm to light the city.
Lamplighters Village – Come help us light the city any or every night at 5pm.

Lamplighter Village is where the core Lamplighters live. These are folks who make it there business to light the lamps of Black Rock City every single night!! Rain or Shine. White Out or No White Out. But you don’t have to live in Lamplighter Village to be a Lamplighter — participants are welcome and encouraged to join the Lamplighters on one, two, or several nights of the festival. This year in BRC there are more lanterns to be lit than ever before and we re going to need more Lamplighters than ever before, and that’s the cold hard truth!Come relax in the shade of our lounge, enjoy a little late afternoon misting, or gander at the Man himself from our observation deck. Then join the rest of the robed ones as we head over to our Center Camp Chapel workspace every night at 5:00 p.m. to prep the lanterns for ritualistic distribution throughout the city!Lamplighter Village is HQ for the first major part on the playa. Join us Monday Night at 10 p.m. for the annual "Bring Your OWN Cup" Lamplighter Sangria Soiree, and find out just what goes on under those robes.And if your teeth are feelin’ a little loose mid-week and you fear you might be catchin’ a case of the ol’ scurvy… Come on by for a heapin’ healpin’ of Hot Sauce’s XXX cajun veggies served up in one of the best Bloody Mary’s you’ll find on the playa. Yep, Wednesday is the new Sunday AND our Bloody Mary Brunch. Bring your own cup! and make it a big ‘un.

A part of Burning Man's Department of Public Works, the Waterworks team manages the Civic Water Program. This includes the delivery logistics of large water deliveries on playa to infrastructure, honorarium art, and theme camps with interactive water usage.  Our office can be found on Esplanade at 5:20 between HEaT and Moop Map HQ.
BRC Waterworks Department Office
Waterworks Customer Service Office
Location of the Temple Guardian & Burn Perimeter training area, as well as the Temple Guardian Helpdesk. Camping for a few guardians and guardian leadership cadre.
The headquarters of the Temple Guardians, including the Guardian & Burn Perimeter training area, Temple Guardian help desk, and Temple Guardian leadership.

Temple Guardians' main duty is to hold the space of the Temple, to ensure an inviting, inclusive environment that allows everyone to experience what they seek without interference. We do so by unobtrusively protecting the peacefulness and safety of both the structure and the participants who visit it

Learn more about what we do and how we do it at: https://templeguardians.burningman.org/wp-content/uploads/Temple-Guardians-Manual-2023-v2.pdf
Training & educating new and veteran guardians to serve and hold space in the temple.  All burners who seek to serve are welcome.
We are the staff support camp and training center for the Temple Guardians.  Our principal responsibility is providing training and volunteers for Temple Guardians shifts.
Our camp hosts Temple Guardian orientation/trainings for new volunteers and returning Guardians.  Temple Guardians offer volunteer opportunities 24/7. Sign up for a shift or three!
If the Temple has a special place in your heart, join us and help hold the space so that others might experience the wonder that brings us back.

The mission of the Temple Guardians is: To hold the space of the Temple, maintaining an environment that allows equal access for everyone to have the experience and expression that they need, and keep the Temple itself, as well as the participants who visit it, safe.

The mission of the Temple Guardians Camp is to hold space for and to serve the Temple Guardians. We do this by creating a warm and welcoming place for Guardians and potential Guardians to gather. We host the training sessions and social events. And as the experience of being a Guardian can be powerful and overwhelming, our camp is a place for them to find a compassionate ear and a knowing Heart.

Providing accessible Playa tours in our adventure rig, with room for about 10 - 13 Burners, leaving from our BUS STOP! art installation on the Playa. Tours go daily at 9am, return you to the BUS STOP! and last about 2hrs. Or meet us at camp prior to the tour! Contact us for info about special tours and pick ups/drop offs. If you are interested in camping with us or driving tours please contact us. To find our camp - look for tall grey feather flags with a big " ! "on them! or check the website for our location closer to the Burn. Come ride with us!

Providing accessible art tours in our adventure rig, with room for about 10 - 16 Burners, leaving from our BUS STOP! art installation on the Playa. Tours go 2x most days for about 1.5hrs, see http://www.blackrockadventures.org for more!

Playa Tours in our accessible adventure rig! 2x/day! Tours abt. 1.5 hrs long, worst come 1st served - mobility challenged, walking wounded, then able bodied....we leave from BLACK ROCK ADVENTURES! Camp first, and pick up from our BUS STOP! Playa Art Installation, location TBA, schedule posted at our camp + the BUS STOP! Usually - 9am and 6pm.  Check http://www.blackrockadventures.org for more.  Join us!

BLACK ROCK ADVENTURES! Magical Mystery Adventure Tours 2X daily, for our Burning Man Community. That means you! We go where  we want to go, sometimes, and where you do too, sometimes. We have room for about 16 people,  priority given to the Mobility challenged, followed by the Walking Wounded and then the Able Bodied, first come are first served. Looking to score some of our tours with musical themes, and such - the ideas we have thus far:
-Grateful Dead Sing-a-Long Tour
-Black Metal Sing-a-Long Tour
- 5 minute Poetry Readings Tour (Read yours or someone else's)
-Nerd Tour
-Silence Tour
-Discovery Tour
-You be the DJ Tour
-DIY Tour
- Bring a paper and Pencil-type thing Tour
Tour Ideas welcome!

Please visit us at www.blackrockadventures.org, send your tour ideas, and see where we will be taking off from - 2X daily!

Media Mecca is home to the members of the Media Team that volunteer to assist press, filmmakers, photographers and other members of the media in the endeavor to document the cultural story of Black Rock City and Burning Man. Come on by to register your media project for publication or to meet up with other photographers, videographers, or journalists.

Media Mecca is an on-playa press room.  Our motley band of reporters, marketers, sociologists, technical writers, artists, anthropologists, clowns, film geeks, and rock stars help prepare journalists for the Burning Man experience, and uphold registration and acculturation processes designed to make visiting media-makers’ impact on Black Rock City and its citizens a positive one.

Media Mecca is the point of contact for all professional media covering the event. In most cases media will have preregistered but some on-site registration is available.

Media Mecca is the place to go for professional media wanting cover Burning Man as news or documentary. Media Mecca will also be the communications center for crisis management or important announcements during the event.

Media Mecca is the contact point for all news media and professional photographers. You must check in here and have your camera tag before you can photograph or film anything for outside distribution or sale. Personal use video cameras need to be register at Playa Infomation which is right next to Media Mecca.

Media Mecca is Black Rock City’s press room — a resource for the media to check in, get information, and learn more about Burning Man. All press are required to pre-register at http://www.burningman.com/press. Media Mecca, located in Center Camp, is open daily from 9 AM-ish to 5 PM-ish.

We think you're pretty cool! Take a quick break in our lounge, meet some of our campmates, or have a boogie at one of our random dance parties. Stop on by, y'all! It's the cool thing to do...

A warm mash-up of special buddies and spuds! Come scoop your soul food at our DIY instant mashed potato bar. All shapes, all sizes, all welcome. Bath in our sound baths or shimmy our scaffolding. Good vibes, thick chats, and people who show up for each other.

Good Air is a Black-centered camp rooted in joy, rest, and radical care. Our name comes from a phrase our aunties yelled—"Don't let the good air out!"—and we've built a sanctuary in BRC that reflects that love and intention. With about 25 campers, we focus on community, co-creation, and cultural grounding. This year, we're also an art support camp for Jen Reed and The Apple Core, the first piece of Compost Playground. Our space includes a front door portal, communal living room, shared infrastructure, and a commitment to radical inclusion, participation, and environmental responsibility.

The Space Between's 7th year on the playa! Come by afternoons for boozie smoothies and groovie toonzies. We also have ping pong and a hidden Tokyo-style Saké bar select nights. Check the digital guide for events and times!

The Space Between's 6th year on the playa! Come by afternoons for boozie smoothies and groovie toonzies. We also have ping pong and a hidden Tokyo-style Saké bar select nights. Check the schedule for events!

At TSB we bring you the chill danceable grooves every sundown, 3 nights of awesome music sets as well as chilled iced coffee served from 2PM-4PM every day. We’ll have sunrise milk and cookies and tea service on select days. See events for more info!

The Space Between offers a relaxed environment to reflect on the space between one playa experience and the next while enjoying our special revival tacos and patented and trademarked rebirth drink.  We will provide the cocktails and music, you bring the dreams.

This is an art camp created by artist Lieyi Shen. Artist Devin Field will carry out a human body painting project in the camp. We look forward to communicating and interacting with participants of the Burning Man.
Nice to MEAT YOU.

North Tahoe Burners serving Burners, Burners...We provide Vegan and animal protein BBQs every afternoon from our Ox & Covered Wagon Art Car Food Truck. Find us in the Camp Directory or out in the Deep.

Nice to MEAT you. We're The Donner Party. We're a mammal and vegan barbecue party we cook everything/everyone! Every afternoon we serve drinks and food to burners who still don't realize they haven't eaten anything since last our Barbecue!
Nice to MEAT you! Come down The Donner Party bbqs every day from 4-6pm where you are what we eat!

If your a dreamer, come on down and let's talk dreams.
We built a ship that doesn't float to sail on a lake that isn't there.
Playa Pete's Plaza. Home port for PV Monaco and sundry mutant vehicles.
Playa Pete's Plaza. Home port for the Monaco Artship and the Kaleidoscope Art Tower.
Playa Pete's Plaza is the home port for the Artship PV Monaco. The PV stands for Playa Vessel and she makes Playa Pete's Plaza her home.

Home of the Famous and mysterious Playa Pete. Yes, he does exist.

Great music, Great Mead, party games, dancing, and general shenanigans. We make janky look good!

Burner Brown is a camp to strap on a comfy cock and work out that BDE.  Cock fighting throughout the week with a chaotic bar, bangin' dj's, and a dildo ring toss to test your "lowering down on it" abilities.  Afternoon parties are our specialty.  We make janky look good!
Great music, party games, dancing, and general shenanigans.  We make janky look good!

Camp 6 Minutes is home to The Scarab and The Cloud art cars and offers a vibrant space to dance, create, and connect. We're all about good music, playful energy, and spontaneous conversations. Whether you're lounging in the shade or joining a dance session, our camp invites you to be yourself and talk some good-natured shit. Come hang, laugh, and recharge with us.
Our camp is a collective of cloud enthusiats dedicated to transporting you to Cloud 9. We leave every 6 minutes.

ART 20 / IQ Test / Dragnet Interrogation...WE do it all! Come and visit the trash fence and see our 13th project on the fence. There will be 75 tennis rackets adorned with fun recycled folk art pieces. In camp we will give you an IQ Test with wacky question and expect fun weird answers. Also we can interrogate you using sound bite from the old Dragnet TV/Radio show. Always fun this is my 20th visit to BRC and always bring the fun!

BlinkingManCamp97 returns! Stop by for a wacky IQ TEST (everyone passes) or get an interrogation by iconic Joe Friday. We ALWAYS have unique swag. After the fun head out to the Trash Fence and visit our ZOOZ - 70 animals inside tennis rackets, project 12 out there by our camp. DRAGNET, it's not just for breakfast any more.

WELCOME BACK! For the 11th time the deep playa trash fence will be much more than a fence. 85 posts will be decorated with folk art, and recycled and repurposed items dangling from TIKIs. As you ride along the fence you will connect and enjoy the tikis and wonder what the heck are some of them? About 15 people have contributed art and the tradition continues. Also from time to time we will run an IQ test (wacky and fun) and returning for the first time DRAGNET INTERROGATION! It was last seen on the playa in 2009. Stop by we have unique swag and you will enjoy the unique experience.  And the TIKIZ will definitely bring a chuckle and a guffaw.......BlinkingManCamp - on the playa since 1997!

The Jive Joint is a full improvised, unrehearsed, and interactive music and comedy experience you dont want to miss! Come to the Center Camp Plaza for "Genius Hour"  starring Super Tall Paul, Rossome, and Sethward!

Icarus Camp Support Camp for Ad Astra

Stone Circles have stood as timeless sentinels - sacred spaces created in reverence and mystery.
Here at Burning Man, we honor this enduring legacy.
We gather in modern ritual, not to replicate the past, but to reignite its spirit.
A Circle of luminous, reflective Monoliths rising from the dust, designed as a portal beyond boundaries, beyond time.
Dedicated to alternative forms of flight. Come fly the friendly playa, of come ply the friendly skies.
Icarus Camp is dedicated to alternative forms of flight.
